title: Alternative to T-star Font
content:
Hello All,

I am looking for a font with a similar feel to T-star. I attached a jpeg if you are unfamiliar. Any suggestions are appreciated. Thanks.

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [Screen Shot 2013-08-13 at 10.07.11 AM.png](http://web.archive.org/web/20150419225252/http:/typophile.com/files/Screen%20Shot%202013-08-13%20at%2010.07.11%20AM.png) | 68.49 KB |
author: A-type

comments.content: Thought about DIN. I really like DIN as a headline font, but I am hesitant to use it for body text. Thanks for the suggestion though.
Thanks guys for the suggestions. Jared, you should get a commission from Newlyn, ended up purchasing Frank.
